meanings.definition: A person or thing that supersedes or replaces another.
meanings.sent1: The new manager became the superseder of the old one.
meanings.sent2: The robot was designed to be a superseder for manual labor.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's sidekick was a superseder of the villain's henchman.
meanings.sent4: In the game of chess, the queen is the ultimate superseder of all other pieces.
meanings.sent5: The crown prince was the designated superseder to the throne.

meanings.definition: To replace or take the place of something or someone.
meanings.sent1: The digital clock will superseder the old analog one in the office.
meanings.sent2: Technology continues to superseder traditional methods in many industries.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick seemed to superseder the laws of physics.
meanings.sent4: The rising sun slowly supersedered the darkness of the night.
meanings.sent5: The new software update will superseder the previous version.
